intro: Bejaria tricolor, commonly known as the three-color plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its strikingly colored leaves that display three distinct shades of green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red, orange, or yellow, adding to its visual appeal. Bejaria tricolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
